intro: Diplostephium ocanense, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a hairy texture, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
